Welcome to Python-Project’s documentation!¶

Car¶

Contains a base Car class

class models.Car.Car(brand: str = None, model: str = None, year: int = None, color: str = 'White', wheels: int = 4, horsePower: int = 0, gears: int = 5)¶

This is a conceptual class representation of a simple Car

Parameters

  • brand (str, optional) – Brand of the car, defaults to “None”

  • model (str, optional) – Model of the car, defaults to “None”

  • year (int, optional) – Year of the car, defaults to “None”

  • color (str, optional) – Color of the car, defaults to “White”

  • wheels (int, optional) – Number of wheels of the car, defaults to 4

  • horsePower (int, optional) – Number of HorsePower of the car, defaults to 0

  • gears (int, optional) – Number of Gears of the car, defaults to 5

accelerate(val=5) → int¶

increases speed by amount of val

Parameters

val – speed unit to be increased

Return speed

current speed of the car

brake(val=5) → int¶

decreases speed by amount of val

Parameters

val – speed unit to be decreased

Return speed

current speed of the car

start() → int¶

starts the car, sets speed to 1 :return speed: current speed of the car

stop() → int¶

stops the car, sets speed to zero :return speed: current speed of the car

CarB¶

Contains a base Car class with builder

class models.CarB.CarB(builder)¶

This is a conceptual class representation of a simple Car

Parameters

  • brand (str, optional) – Brand of the car

  • model (str, optional) – Model of the car

  • year (int, optional) – Year of the car

  • color (str, optional) – Color of the car

  • wheels (int, optional) – Number of wheels of the car

  • horsePower (int, optional) – Number of HorsePower of the car

  • gears (int, optional) – Number of Gears of the car
